Our mission is to provide innovative high-performance operational, technological, and financial solutions to AXA entities Worldwide.As part of the mission, the Senior Accountant role is specifically designed to support to GO US Accounting Team, focusing on U.S accounting practices and the application of IFRS Standards. Accounting standardsExperience in financial reporting, reconciliations, and managing journal entries.Advanced skills in ExcelFamiliarity with Power BI is a plus.Soft Skills:Exceptionnal organizational and analytical abilitiesEffective communication skills and ability to collaborate with diverse teams.Attention to detail and a proactive problem-solving mindset.Languages:Fluency in English and French, written and spoken, is mandatory.

About the jobRole OverviewWe are looking for a seasoned and dynamicHR Managerto lead all aspects of Human Resources operations in Morocco. This role is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing HR strategies and processes that support business growth, legal compliance, and employee well-being across the Moroccan office.The ideal candidate brings hands-on experience in HR management within the fintech, payments, or technology sectors, and has a deep understanding of Moroccan labor law, employee relations, and operational HR excellence.Key Responsibilities1. HR Operations & AdministrationLead end-to-end HR operations including onboarding, contracts, attendance, leaves, performance tracking, and exit processes.Maintain accurate and legally compliant employee records and HR documentation.Manage local payroll inputs, coordinate with finance for salary processing, and oversee statutory filings.Handle visa processes, work permits, and employment documentation in coordination with legal and PRO.2. Talent Acquisition & Workforce PlanningManage end-to-end recruitment processes for the Morocco office, from requisition to onboarding.Build a strong local talent pool aligned with business needs and potential localization/nationalization policies.Support confidential hiring for sensitive or senior-level roles within the region.3. Employee Relations & EngagementAct as a point of contact for employees and management on HR matters, offering guidance and resolution support.Manage employee grievances, disciplinary issues, and conflict resolution in line with company policy and labor law.Drive employee engagement, retention initiatives, and culture-building activities.4. Compliance & Policy ImplementationEnsure compliance with Moroccan labor law and all regulatory requirements related to employment.Develop and implement local HR policies and procedures that align with best practices and business requirements.Prepare for and support internal and external audits related to HR practices and documentation.5. Performance Management & TrainingCoordinate performance reviews, goal setting, and evaluation processes across departments.Identify training needs and facilitate L&D initiatives to support employee development and succession planning.Promote a performance-driven culture through effective feedback and development frameworks.6. HR Reporting & Strategy SupportProvide regular reports and HR metrics to senior management for decision-making.Support HR budgeting, workforce planning, and local HR projects including process improvements and system rollouts.Actively contribute to building a future-ready HR function aligned with regional growth and operational priorities.Key QualificationsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. HR certifications (e.g., CIPD, SHRM) are a plus.5‚Äì8 years of progressive HR experience in Morocco, with at least 2 years in a managerial capacity.Industry experience in fintech, payments, digital banking, or technology-driven sectors is strongly preferred.Strong understanding of Moroccan labor law, payroll, and compliance requirements.Excellent communication and relationship-building skills; able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Fluent in French and English (written and spoken); Arabic is an added advantage.High integrity, professionalism, and discretion in handling confidential matters.Preferred AttributesDemonstrated success in setting up HR operations or scaling HR practices in a fast-growth environment.Hands-on experience with HR systems (HRIS) and digital collaboration tools.Proactive, adaptable, and solutions-focused approach with a strong people-first mindset.

job_title: Full Stack Developer ( Remote from Anywhere)
description: About the jobAbout JobgetherJobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.One of our companies is currently looking for aFull Stack DeveloperinAnywhere.As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a key role in building and enhancing both web and mobile applications that connect users with local artisan products. You'll join a cross-functional team responsible for the full software development lifecycle, from ideation to deployment. Your work will directly impact the user experience, performance, and scalability of the platform. We are looking for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, has a strong attention to detail, and brings a passion for clean, maintainable code. Collaboration with engineering, product, and design teams is essential to success in this role.Accountabilities:Collaborate with the development team and product manager to conceptualize software solutionsDesign and implement client-side and server-side architecturesBuild user interfaces based on Figma designs using React and Material UIDevelop scalable, efficient backend services using Node.js and GraphQLConduct thorough testing to ensure responsiveness, robustness, and high performanceTroubleshoot and debug issues, deploying improvements across platformsParticipate in continuous improvement of the development workflow through code reviews and CI/CD processesRequirements3+ years of full-time experience with React, React Native (or similar frameworks)3+ years of experience with Node.js and TypeScriptSolid experience integrating Figma designs and building performant frontendsStrong understanding of backend development using GraphQL and AWS LambdaFamiliarity with AWS services including DynamoDB, AppSync, and CDKProficiency in GitLab CI/CD or equivalent toolsFull-time availability (40+ hours/week) with at least 2 hours overlap with US Pacific TimeExcellent verbal and written English communicationComfortable collaborating asynchronously via Slack, email, and video callsBenefits100% remote work from anywhereOpportunity to work on a high-impact product in a fast-growing environmentDynamic and collaborative work cultureCompetitive salary based on experience, location, and skillFast-track advancement opportunities based on performanceWork closely with a talented and motivated international teamFlexible hours with strong emphasis on results over micromanagementJobgether hiring process disclaimerThis job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 daysIf you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experienceThank you for your interest!

description: About the jobWho we are:üí°Onclusive is a world leader in media intelligence technology and services dedicated to supporting PR, Communication and Marketing professionals. We deliver leading-edge innovation, human expertise, and unmatched media reach in a suite of media management, monitoring and analysis solutions that support every stage of the communications cycle. About the jobMarketing RepresentativeAre you a creative thinker with a passion for marketing and a knack for driving sales? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a significant impact in the airline industry? Join our team at Turkish Airlines, where we value innovative ideas and strive to reach new heights in our marketing and sales efforts.As a Sales-Driven Marketing Representative, you will play a key role in conducting insightful market research, developing effective sales strategies, and evaluating marketing processes to drive success. If you're ready to bring your creativity, analytical skills, and friendly demeanor to a dynamic team focused on driving sales, this role is perfect for you. Come join us and be part of our journey to inspire and captivate audiences with our exceptional services!Responsibilities:‚Ä¢ As a Marketing Representative, you will develop and manage relations with Agents and Customers. You will actively seek out new markets and ensure timely communication of fares/charges, regulations, and innovations to our agents.‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for producing weekly and monthly activity reports. These reports will document sales activity against targets, highlighting positive and negative sales results. Additionally, you will provide recommendations for alternate sales strategies to counteract negative results when necessary.‚Ä¢ Maintaining strong and ongoing relationships with agents in your region will be a key part of your role. You will focus on increasing regional sales and examining the potential of recently launched routes. It's important to keep your supervisors informed about competitor airlines' policies in this regard.‚Ä¢ Staying up-to-date on current marketing trends and monitoring the practices of other carriers operating in the market will be crucial. Your insights and proposals will contribute to our continuous growth and success.‚Ä¢ You will have the exciting opportunity to represent Turkish Airlines at tourism events and trade fairs. These platforms will allow you to showcase our exceptional services and engage with potential customers.Qualifications:‚Ä¢ Minimum Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred).‚Ä¢ At least 2 years of relevant experience in civil aviation or tourism.‚Ä¢ Excellent command of English and local language(s).‚Ä¢ Valid work permit or citizenship in the respective country (we are unable to provide or assist with work permits).‚Ä¢ A team player who can also work independently when necessary.‚Ä¢ Proficiency in MS Office products and other relevant informatics tools.We strive to bring the far close by making the world move through our wings. We are working with all our strengths to offer our guests a unique experience while connecting 340 destinations around the world. We would like to see you among us in our success story to which each member of our family contributes. Now it is time to grow our family with you to achieve greater goals.

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer, Bot & Fraud Detection
description: About the jobAbout CastleCastle is a Series A startup on a mission to create a safer online world by protecting platforms from fraud, abuse, and malicious activity. Trusted by companies like Canva, Atlassian, and Rockstar Games, we‚Äôre backed by Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and top-tier angels from Datadog, Stripe, and New Relic. Our fast-moving team is scaling globally, helping platforms stay secure while thriving in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.The roleAs a Machine Learning Engineer specializing in Bot & Fraud Detection, you will develop AI-driven fraud prevention systems that continuously adapt to evolving attack patterns. Your work will directly impact real-time bot mitigation, anomaly detection, and automated rule generation, ensuring Castle remains one step ahead of attackers.You will work closely with our Head of Research,Antoine Vastel, a recognized expert in bot detection and browser fingerprinting, to integrate cutting-edge fraud detection models into Castle‚Äôs AI-driven defense engine. With direct access to rich behavioral data and a modern ML stack, you‚Äôll be able to iterate quickly and deploy models that make an immediate impact.In addition to traditional ML-based fraud detection, you will also leverage LLMs to classify traffic patterns, detect anomalies, and optimize application performance. You will experiment with the latest advancements in AI, ensuring Castle is at the forefront of modern fraud prevention technology.What you‚Äôll doYou will develop AI-powered fraud detection models, leveraging behavioral analysis, anomaly detection, and adversarial ML techniques to uncover evasive bot behavior. Our structured data pipelines and well-instrumented fraud signals ensure you‚Äôll spend more time solving complex problems and less time wrangling data.You will explore LLMs for traffic classification, using modern AI architectures to analyze session behavior, detect anomalies, and optimize fraud detection models. With seamless access to large-scale real-world fraud datasets, you'll have everything you need to push the boundaries of AI-driven fraud prevention.What you bring5+ years of experience in machine learning, fraud detection, or adversarial AI, preferably in security-focused environments.Strong background in anomaly detection, behavioral modeling, and adversarial ML techniques for detecting fraudulent activity and bot behavior.Experience developing and optimizing real-time ML pipelines for high-speed fraud detection.Hands-on experience deploying and fine-tuning LLMs, with a deep understanding of prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and large-scale inference.Deep understanding of supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques for adaptive fraud prevention.Familiarity with fraud signals, device intelligence, and behavioral analytics for bot detection and risk assessment.Experience with vector-based search, feature engineering, and scalable model inference for real-time fraud prevention.Ability to collaborate across Threat Research, Infrastructure, and JavaScript Engineering teams to develop end-to-end ML-powered fraud detection.BenefitsWe pay US salaries globally. $153,000-$196,000 per year for this role.Flexible work hours. We prioritize outcomes over hours spent.Unlimited PTO. Take the time you need to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance.Paid parental leave. Supporting new parents during their transition.We‚Äôll supply the computer and related gear you need to excel.

Instead, you will gain freedom, high earning potential, and the backing of a company that understands what recruiters need to succeed.Back yourself. Partner with Halr Tech.

documentation of product requirements, user stories, and project progress, and prepare feature and product documentation.You foster transparent communication and alignment across a multicultural team Succeeding in this role will grow Pencil‚Äôs presence in major procurement cycles, establish us as a preferred partner among intermediaries, and help shift global marketing budgets toward GenAI.Key ResponsibilitiesBuilding and maintaining strong relationships with marketing intermediaries and pitch consultantsMonitoring and qualifying inbound RFP/RFI opportunities from intermediaries and prospectsWriting compelling, tailored responses that clearly articulate Pencil‚Äôs value and capabilitiesCoordinating with internal stakeholders to assemble pricing, legal, product and case study inputsBuilding a library of reusable proposal assets (e.g., slides, templates, responses) to accelerate future pitchesYour KPIs will be linked to the following:Volume and quality of intermediary relationships established and maintainedRFP win rate and value of deals influenced by intermediary and consultant engagementRevenue and pipeline growth attributable to formal proposal processesQualifications and ExperienceHave 3+ years in SaaS, enterprise sales, or agency/consultancy BD rolesExperience managing or contributing to RFP/RFI responses in a marketing or technology contextUnderstanding of the intermediary/consultancy landscape (e.g. The Observatory, R3, AAR, Flock)Clear, persuasive writing skills and experience creating commercial pitch collateralTrack record of working cross-functionally with sales, legal and product teamsBenefitsFully remote work including WeWork "All Access" membershipOpportunity to work at the cutting edge of GenAI for the Fortune 500Sponsored professional and personal learningTop-end Apple hardwareFlexible vacation/time-off policyCompetitive health insurance and welfare cover

Operating at the intersection of digital finance, cross-border payments, and blockchain-based infrastructure, the company is building a scalable ecosystem supporting businesses and consumers across various jurisdictions.Position Overview:The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) will serve as a strategic partner to the CEO and founding team, responsible for all financial planning, operations, and compliance. This role is designed for a hands-on financial leader who can combine financial rigor with strategic insight in a fast-moving, regulated environment. The ideal candidate will be deeply analytical, operationally experienced, and capable of managing global financial complexity ‚Äî not just a traditional accountant, but a financial strategist and builder.Key Responsibilities1. Strategic Financial Modeling & Unit EconomicsDesign, maintain, and refine 12‚Äì24 month forward-looking financial models.Monitor and optimize unit economics across products, geographies, clients, and channels.Develop growth forecasts, scenario planning, and what-if analyses for executives and investors.Create clear, dynamic dashboards for the executive team and board.2. Cash Flow & Revenue OversightManage global cash flow, burn rate, and runway.Oversee both fiat and crypto financial operations, including transaction volumes, card usage, exchanges, and SWIFT activity.Coordinate multiple revenue channels (e.g., SaaS, transaction fees, partnerships).Establish and manage financial responsibility centers (P&Ls) across business units.3. Regulatory Licensing & Financial ComplianceLead the financial component of acquiring and maintaining licenses (e.g., MSB, EMI, VASP).Coordinate the preparation of financial statements and filings across regions including the EU, US, LATAM, and Asia.Collaborate with compliance to ensure a regulator-friendly financial architecture.4. International Corporate & Treasury StructureOversee global holding and subsidiary structures to align with regulatory, tax, and operational requirements.Design payment routing and treasury systems for optimal flow and tax efficiency.Work alongside legal, accounting, and audit teams across jurisdictions.5. Investor Relations & Capital ManagementPrepare and maintain investor materials, including financial models, pitch decks, and KPIs.Manage data room and support due diligence for current and future investment rounds.Assist in fundraising strategy, negotiations, and financial storytelling.Candidate ProfileProfessional BackgroundProven experience as a CFO or VP of Finance in a high-growth fintech, neobank, digital asset platform, or infrastructure company.Hands-on experience in building granular, product-level financial models.Prior involvement in raising institutional capital (Seed through Series B or later).Strong understanding of complex financial ecosystems involving multiple licenses, jurisdictions, and revenue models.Technical & Functional SkillsExpert-level Excel / Google Sheets modeling (board-ready, clear, and intuitive).Experience collaborating with auditors, legal teams, and tax professionals.Knowledge of IFRS and/or US GAAP is a plus, though not mandatory.Fluent in English; additional languages are a plus.What the Company OffersExecutive role in a venture-backed, high-growth fintech platform.Remote-first culture with a global team.Opportunity to define and build the financial backbone of a next-generation financial services company.Direct impact on company strategy and trajectory.How to ApplyCandidates who meet the qualifications and are excited about building scalable financial infrastructure in a global fintech environment are encouraged to apply. Following successful shortlisting you will be invited for a 20 minute screening phone call and to follow 2-3 remote interviews.

About the jobI. Company IntroductionSince its establishment in 2000, Tinci Materials has been at the forefront of the global fine chemical and new energy lithium battery materials sectors, standing as a leading enterprise in lithium battery materials. In the field of electrolyte products, the company boasts a global market share of over 30%. Beyond its deep involvement in lithium battery materials, Tinci Materials' business portfolio also extends to various segments such as personal care materials and silicone rubber materials, making it a significant player in the global fine chemical market.Tinci Materials Jorf Lasfar, our Moroccan subsidiary registered in El Jadida, shoulders a crucial strategic mission. With a planned investment of $280 million, it is fully committed to the production and sales of lithium-ion battery materials. In the future, the Moroccan subsidiary will serve as a key component of Tinci Materials' global layout, aiming to build a modern lithium battery materials production base. Through localized production, it will reduce costs, enhance product competitiveness, and supply high-quality lithium-ion battery materials to the European and global markets, driving the development of the new energy vehicle industry. Additionally, TINCI will establish a comprehensive lithium battery materials industrial chain ecosystem, injecting strong impetus into the economic development and industrial upgrading of the Casablanca region, and working together towards a sustainable future.II. Position IntroductionThis HR position will play a vital role in the human resources management of Tinci Materials' Moroccan subsidiary. The successful candidate will collaborate with the HR team at the headquarters to gradually participate in building the human resources system of the Moroccan subsidiary. Based on the progress of the Moroccan project, the candidate will be responsible for recruitment and staffing. As the first member of the HR team in the Moroccan subsidiary, the candidate will contribute significantly to local HR functions such as compensation and training. The position is initially located in the office at Ain Diab, Anfa, Casablanca, and may be relocated to Jorf Lasfar Industrial Park, El Jadida in the future. The successful candidate is required to travel to the Chinese headquarters for training periodically in the early stage of employment and on an irregular basis thereafter.III. ResponsibilitiesHuman Resources Planning: Under the guidance of superiors, formulate long - and short - term human resources plans that align with the global investment strategy, local market conditions, and factory construction progress. Assist in anticipating talent requirements for different construction stages in engineering, management, and other fields, and participate in establishing a talent reserve pool.Recruitment and Allocation: Develop an annual recruitment plan under the leadership of superiors, focusing on core positions of the factory. Leverage international platforms, local intermediaries, and employee referrals to recruit professionals familiar with local regulations and the construction environment. Assist in the selection process for expatriate employees, optimize recruitment procedures, and ensure timely staff onboarding.Training and Development: Participate in formulating a comprehensive training system for new employees, with a focus on assisting in engineering and technical training. Assist in providing cross - cultural, local regulations, and customs training for expatriate employees, and organize multicultural activities to promote employee collaboration.Performance Management: Under the guidance of superiors, design a performance management system that complies with local regulations and culture and is centered around factory construction objectives. Assist in setting quantifiable KPIs, conduct regular evaluations, and use diverse incentive measures to improve employee efficiency and work quality.Compensation and Benefits Management: Design a competitive compensation and benefits plan by referring to local and industry - leading compensation systems. Assist in implementing basic benefits, planning housing, transportation, and other allowances. Assist in promoting the selection and implementation of payroll software to ensure accurate and efficient payroll calculation and distribution.Employee Relations Management: Assist expatriate employees in handling local labor contracts, visas, and residence permits. Participate in establishing multi - channel communication mechanisms, resolve employees' work and life issues in a timely manner, and assist in strengthening cooperation with local labor unions.IV. RequirementsEducational Background: Bachelor's degree or above in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related majors.Work Experience: At least 1 year of relevant work experience in human resources. Prior experience in human resources management in the manufacturing or engineering project construction sectors is preferred. Experience in multinational enterprises is a plus.Professional Skills: Familiarity with basic human resources work, understanding of Moroccan labor laws and regulations, excellent English communication skills for work purposes, proficiency in using human resources management software and office software.Comprehensive Qualities: Strong learning ability and sense of responsibility, certain organizational coordination and problem - solving skills, adaptability to business trips and overseas work environments, and a willingness to actively learn advanced human resources management experience from the Chinese headquarters.V. Position HighlightsGrowth Opportunities: Join a global leading enterprise in the new energy materials industry and rapidly enhance professional capabilities and accumulate international human resources management experience through periodic training at the Chinese headquarters.Career Prospects: As a member of the startup team, enjoy broad career advancement opportunities with the rapid development of the Moroccan subsidiary.Diverse Team: Work with outstanding talents from different countries and regions, experience the collision and integration of diverse cultures, and improve overall personal capabilities.Attractive Remuneration: Receive a competitive compensation and benefits package, including generous allowances, comprehensive overseas insurance, paid leave, etc., to address your concerns.

About the jobCompany OverviewBuild your brand. Tell your story. About the jobMISSIONPMO is a business partner who thinks and acts in a business way, our focus is to support our Customer in the achievement of their Vision and Goals while anticipating, calling out, and helping to solve potential risks.CHALLENGESMinimising risk: as a Project Manager, you will be required to juggle a great many situations to ensure the project does not fail.Keeping the team aligned: miscommunication can cause problems very quickly, so it is essential that the Project Manager makes themselves the conduit for discussions about the project, and that everyone involved knows what is expected of them and why.Right skills: Project managers can‚Äôt bring in a project if they are not supported by a team with the right skills. About the jobAt Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. You‚Äôll work alongside dynamic and collaborative teammates.You'll play a key role in ensuring seamless supply chain operations throughout the lifecycle of our projects. Day-to-day, you‚Äôll work closely with teams across the business (tender, industrial, and supplier management teams), manage supply chain processes, and ensure alignment with quality, cost, and delivery (QCD) objectives, and much more.You‚Äôll specifically take care of designing supply chain networks during the tender phase, securing project ramp-ups, and managing changes and crises during the project lifecycle, but also coordinating supply chain activities during project closures.We‚Äôll look to you for:Designing supply chain processes based on tender requirements and committing to direct costs (e.g., direct hours, packaging costs).Setting up and synchronizing supply chain processes with industrial requirements during ramp-up phases.Driving key activities to ensure supplier deliveries, logistics flows, stock policies, and systems meet QCD objectives.Identifying and managing supplier risks, including capacity assessments and logistics specifications for business awards.Coordinating supply chain activities related to planning changes, supplier modifications, or technical updates.Supporting supply chain teams in resolving critical delivery issues and anticipating material shortages.Minimizing costs and obsolete inventories during project closures while securing the end of production.All About YouWe value passion and attitude over experience. Instead, we‚Äôve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:Master‚Äôs degree in Supply Chain or Logistics.Experience in supply chain operations, preferably in supplier/customer relationships, project management, or industrial settings.Fluent in both French and English.Knowledge of ERP material management (e.g., master data, purchase orders) or ERP architecture understanding (e.g., BOM, NCR).Ability to deal quickly and effectively with a variety of topics.Strong analytical skills to summarize and focus on critical issues.A results-driven mindset with a proactive approach to challenges.Things you‚Äôll enjoyJoin us on a life-long transformative journey ‚Äì the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You‚Äôll also:Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routinesWork with new security standards for rail signallingCollaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleaguesContribute to innovative projectsUtilise our flexible and inclusive working environmentSteer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countriesBenefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learningProgress towards leadership roles or specialized supply chain functionsBenefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)You don‚Äôt need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. If you‚Äôre up for the challenge, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!Important to noteAs a global business, we‚Äôre an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

job_title: Supply Chain Leader  ‚Äì Automotive Brownfield Plant (m/w/d)
description: About the jobRole Purpose:As the Supply Chain Leader for our newbrownfield and greenfield plant, you will take full ownership of establishing and leading all supply chain functions. This includes designing infrastructure, implementing systems, and leading procurement, warehousing, and logistics operations to make and then maintain the plant operational.Key Responsibilities:End-to-End Supply Chain SetupDesign and implement supply chain infrastructure and processes in coordination with Project and Regional teams.Ensure efficient material flow (raw materials and finished goods) with 100% on-time delivery (OTD).Optimize inbound, storage, and outbound logistics costs in collaboration with the SSCM function.Develop and maintain warehousing procedures (receiving, storing, picking, dispatching).Procurement & Logistics OperationsLead operational purchasing, warehousing, and inbound/outbound logistics to support uninterrupted production and delivery.Secure application of customer and internal specifications, including accurate use of ERP system parameters.Inventory Management & ImprovementEnsure optimal inventory levels to balance availability, cost, and working capital targets.Drive improvements ininventory accuracy,cycle counting, andstock visibilityacross raw materials, WIP, and finished goods.Implement proactive measures tominimize obsolete and excess stock, especially in high-risk areas such as cable components subject to design changes.Analyze demand variability and lead time constraints to define dynamic safety stock policies and replenishment strategies.Coordinate with upstream and downstream partners to align inventory buffers across the supply chain.ERP & Digital Tools ImplementationRoll out ERP systems, dashboards, and digital tools to enable real-time visibility and effective control of procurement, inventory, and logistics.Ensure full integration of supply chain processes in the ERP with correct and up-to-date master data.Customs & Trade ComplianceEstablish and maintain compliant customs and trade procedures aligned with Moroccan and international regulations.Monitor regulatory changes to ensure compliance and optimize import/export costs.Stakeholder & Supplier CoordinationBuild strong relationships with suppliers, customers, customs authorities, and 3PLs to ensure reliable and responsive operations.Engage early with engineering and sourcing teams to anticipate changes and manage transitions effectively.Continuous Improvement & Cost OptimizationLead value-add initiatives (e.g., deflation and productivity projects) to enhance supply chain efficiency and profitability.Apply Lean principles, enforce 5S standards, and ensure full compliance with health and safety regulations.Performance MonitoringMonitor and drive improvement of key KPIs, including:On-time delivery (OTD)Inventory accuracy and turnoverFreight and logistics cost optimizationObsolescence and excess stock reductionCustomer satisfactionOverall supply chain responsiveness and agilityWhy Join Us?Be a founding team member at a major automotive manufacturing site.Shape the supply chain strategy and infrastructure from scratch.Play a critical role in a high-impact, career-defining project.A dynamic, international work environment focused on growth and continues improvement.Comprehensive onboarding training.Ongoing support from the Regional and Project Teams.Competitive salary and benefits package.Your Profile:University degree in Logistics, Engineering, Business, or related field.3+ years of experience in supply chain or logistics leadership in automotive industry, preferably in a wiring harness industry.Experience with greenfield or brownfield project(s).Familiar with Moroccan import/export regulations and local logistics ecosystem.Proficient in SCM tools.Strong leadership, planning, and communication skills with a hands-on, proactive approachWell-organized and reliable, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.Ability to adapt quickly to changing project requirements.Familiarity with IATF/IRIS and Lean Manufacturing principles.Fluent in English, Arabic and French.If you are passionate about the automotive industry and purchasing, and are driven by challenges, apply by submitting your CV in English.

About the jobLead and manage customer service team and the procurement team for all the site:Define and follow up indicators and targets for the team.Support the implementation with the appropriate departments (APU, Logistics, Purchasing, VPS) tools and methods in order to improve the supply chain organization like Pull flow, Kanban, EDI, Milk run.Coordinate And Manage The Site SIOP And MPS ProcessesLead the site monthly SIOP and weekly MPS meetings.Lead SIOP and MPS processes at site level and identify internal and external bottlenecks.Improve continuously the SIOP and MPS processes. Propose action plans to improve the service levelManage InventoryManage and co-ordinate the procurement team to reach the MPS service rate and inventory level required.Lead actions connected with stock reductions and follow up inventory target realization.Lead Logistics/Purchasing meetings and follow up related action plans.Propose logistics protocol with suppliers in co-operation with External flow analyst and Purchasing.Coordinate inventory management for components through inventory targets.

job_title: Software Engineer, Bot & Fraud Detection Platform
description: About the jobAbout CastleCastle is building real-time infrastructure to protect SaaS platforms from fraud, abuse, and malicious automation. Our product stops bots, detects account abuse, and helps teams fight sophisticated attacks without slowing down real users.We‚Äôre trusted by companies like Canva, Atlassian, and Rockstar Games, and backed by Y Combinator, Index Ventures, and top-tier angels from Stripe, Datadog, and New Relic.The roleCastle‚Äôs detection platform is only as strong as the system behind it. You‚Äôll architect and own the pipelines, rules engines, and fingerprint intelligence systems that power our core product.This is a hands-on role with high leverage. You won‚Äôt be implementing dashboards or frontend features; you‚Äôll be building the substrate that enables us to detect and adapt to real-world attacks at scale.You‚Äôll work directly with our Head of ResearchAntoine Vastelto automate detection logic, integrate adversarial ML and anomaly detection, and drive the evolution of our internal data architecture.This is one of the most foundational roles in the company.What you‚Äôll doDesign and optimize Castle‚Äôs detection infrastructure for speed, resilience, and adaptivityBuild real-time pipelines that ingest and process behavior, fingerprint, and fraud signalsCreate automation for rule deployment and fingerprint updates with millisecond latencyDevelop a dynamic detection layer that can reconfigure in response to novel attacksApply vector-based search and event-driven architectures to classify and cluster threat behaviorEnable seamless developer access to detection primitives‚Äîwithout exposing detection secretsCollaborate tightly across detection, ML, product, and infrastructure to keep attackers out and users safeWhat you bring5+ years of experience in detection engineering, bot mitigation, or security data pipelinesDeep understanding of stream processing and event-driven systems (Kafka, Flink, etc.)Experience building low-latency, real-time systems for detection or automationStrong grasp of fingerprinting, reputation scoring, and adversarial attack patternsExperience with high-performance DBs like ClickHouse, Redis, or similarFamiliarity with ML tools (e.g., anomaly detection, clustering, vector search)A platform builder‚Äôs mindset‚Äîyou want to enable others, not just build features

About the jobPurpose of the role:The Financial Compliance Data analytics specialist is a pivotal role for integrating Microsoft Power Apps expertise into the organization's financial controls and compliance governance architecture. This role demands extensive knowledge and experience in using Microsoft Power Apps, Power BI and alongside other IT capabilities to improve risk management practices and internal controls. Focus on developing, implementing, and improving risk management practices, specifically enhancing Microsoft Power BI.Roles and Responsibilities:We are only considering candidates from Romania, Serbia, Slovenia, Slovakia, Hungary & Czech Republic.Risk Management Practices: You will play a supporting role in developing, implementing, and continuously improving risk management practices. This entails collaborating closely with multi-functional teams to identify potential risks, evaluate their impact on the organization, and devise strategies to optimally mitigate or control them.Internal Controls: You will be responsible for supporting the establishment and maintenance of robust internal control systems across all business processes and functions. This includes assessing existing controls, identifying gaps or weaknesses, and implementing vital improvements to safeguard the companies assets, data, and reputation.Compliance and Ethical Behavior: Supervising compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and acceptable ethical behavior is a critical aspect of the role. You should ensure that the organization adheres to relevant financial and legal standards.Information and Technology Security: You will collaborate with ITS and information security teams to assess and improve information and technology security measures.Testing and Reporting: Testing is foreseen to be a key responsibility and area where you would dedicate most of the time and efforts. You will be conducting detailed testing and generating comprehensive reports on the adequacy and efficiency of risk management, including internal controls. These reports will be presented to senior management and relevant customers, providing valuable insights for decision-making and continuous improvement.Continuous Improvement: You will actively drive continuous improvement within the organization. This involves finding opportunities to improve risk management processes and internal controls, implementing standard methodologies, and staying updated with emerging trends in financial compliance and risk management.Training and Awareness: Conduct training sessions and awareness programs for employees and customers on compliance requirements, internal controls, and their role in maintaining a compliant and risk-aware culture.Job RequirementsSolid Understanding of MS office tools (MS Tables, Power Apps, Power automate, BI), ServiceNow experienceRisk Management Experience: Some knowledge and understanding of risk management principles, practices, and methodologies, including risk identification, assessment, mitigation, and monitoring.Internal Controls: Some experience in crafting, implementing, and evaluating internal control systems to ensure the safeguarding of assets and compliance with policies and procedures.Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to analyze sophisticated data, identify patterns, and draw meaningful insights to make informed decisions and address compliance and risk-related challenges.Interpersonal Skills: Good verbal and written communication skillsAuditing and Reporting: Some familiarity with auditing principles.Ethics and Integrity: Proven dedication to ethical behavior and a strong sense of integrity when handling sensitive financial and compliance matters.Collaboration and Leadership: The skill to work closely with cross-functional teams and lead discussions on risk-related topics and control improvements.Technology and Data Analysis: Understanding technology tools for data analysis, data visualization, and risk monitoring.Business Insight: Some understanding of the organization's business operations, objectives, and industry dynamics to align compliance efforts with overall strategic goals.Critical Thinking: Ability to think critically and strategically when evaluating risk scenarios and developing appropriate risk management strategies.Change Management: Thrives in multifaceted environments, encouraging a culture of adaptability and awareness of organizational risks.Continuous Learning: A dedication to staying updated on industry trends, regulatory changes, and standard methodologies in financial compliance and risk management.Company description: SoftwareOneis a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With an IP and technology-driven services portfolio, it enables companies to holistically develop and implement their commercial, technology and digital transformation strategies. This is achieved by modernizing applications and migrating critical workloads to public clouds, while simultaneously managing and optimizing the related software and cloud assets and licenses. SoftwareOne‚Äôs offerings are connected by PyraCloud, its proprietary digital platform, which provides customers with data-driven, actionable intelligence. With around 9250 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 60 countries, SoftwareOne provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. SoftwareOne‚Äôs shares (SWON) are listed on SIX Swiss Exchange.

About the jobCompany OverviewBuild your brand. Tell your story. As a Business Analytics Analyst, your mission is to deliver data-driven insights that improve business performance, optimize customer engagement, and drive efficiency and revenue growth. and subscription services.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and monitor key metrics (e.g., churn, acquisition, retention, revenue) to identify trends, and diagnose challenges to improve outcomes.Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover business opportunities and risks.Identify process optimization opportunities and drive operational improvements.Deliver insightful outputs to stakeholders, translating data into measurable business actions.Partner with analytics engineering to refine data models per governance standards.Support predictive and prescriptive analytics initiatives in partnership with data science.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align analytics with strategic goals.Ensure data accuracy and integrity by validating sources and methodologies.Provide training and support to promote widespread adoption of data-driven insights.Top Performers in This Role Will Demonstrate:Strong ability to translate data into insights that drive strategic business decisions.Skilled in analyzing and optimizing subscription and software performance metrics.Expert in defining metrics that measure customer behavior and drive business decisions.Attention to detail and the ability to tell a compelling story in various formatsCollaborative mindset to work effectively across teams and senior stakeholders.Continuous learning and adaptability in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.Qualifications:5+ years of experience in business analytics or a data-focused role.Master‚Äôs in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.Proficiency in SQL, Python, or other data analysis tools, plus experience with data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).Experience working with large datasets and applying statistical analysis techniques.Familiarity with notebook-based workflows (Jupyter, Databricks) is a plus.Strong communication and storytelling skills to translate data into actionable insights.Professional English is required (must have)A collaborative, open-minded team player with strong interpersonal skills.Proactive, passionate, and human-first approach to problem-solving.Passion for automotive software and subscription-based business models.Diversity engagementAt Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.What we offerJoining Stellantis means gaining access to a wealth of opportunities and benefits, including:Professional Development:Opportunities for ongoing professional development and advancement, ensuring you're always at the forefront of industry trends and innovations.Global Exposure:Exposure to a global work environment, where you'll collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and cultures, broadening your horizons and expanding your network.Inclusive Culture:An inclusive and collaborative company culture, where every voice is valued and respected, fostering a sense of belonging and camaraderie among our team members.Expert Mentorship:Mentorship from industry experts who are dedicated to sharing their knowledge and guiding you on your career journey, providing invaluable insights and support along the way.

Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.About BCG PlatinionBCG Platinion's presence spans across the globe, with offices in Asia, Europe, and South and North America. At BCG Platinion, we deliver business value through the innovative use of technology at a rapid pace. We roll up our sleeves to transform business, revolutionize approaches, satisfy customers, and change the game through Architecture, Cybersecurity, Digital Transformation, Enterprise Application and Risk functions. We balance vision with a pragmatic path to change transforming strategies into leading-edge tech platforms, at scale.About BCG PlatinionBCG Platinion‚Äôs presence spans across the globe, with offices in Asia, Europe, and South and North America. We achieve digital excellence for clients with sustained solutions to the most complex and time-sensitive challenge. We guide clients into the future to push the status quo, overcome tech limitations, and enable our clients to go further in their digital journeys than what has ever been possible in the past. At BCG Platinion, we deliver business value through the innovative use of technology at a rapid pace. We roll up our sleeves to transform business, revolutionize approaches, satisfy customers, and change the game through Architecture, Cybersecurity, Digital Transformation, Enterprise Application and Risk functions. We balance vision with a pragmatic path to change transforming strategies into leading-edge tech platforms, at scale.What You'll DoAt BCG Platinion we're keen to engage with experienced, passionate and creative technology consultants & IT professionals who will help us unlock our client's digital potential and ignite change. Meaningful work is at the core of everything we do. We build unique solutions to the complexities our clients face, while providing our people with opportunities to explore and grow. A community of leading experts, BCG Platinion team members have a natural springboard for professional growth and deeper opportunities to excel. As a Senior IT Consultant, you will work closely with our client's leadership teams to understand their key challenges, define IT strategies, win buy-in for your recommendations and collaborate with BCG case team members to transform client potential into performance. You will deploy customized IT strategies, digital platforms and architecture in order to leverage the digital potential of our customers with state of the art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices and containerization. You will be responsible for specific parts of the project and will evaluate and coach our clients' technology teams, manage quality and risk while maintaining client expectations and escalations. You'll develop ground-breaking projects by enabling our clients to effectively use agile methods and modern approaches in the context of strategic IT implementation. You will work on a variety of technology topics, applying your technical consulting skills to strategic technology questions. You will also be supported by an extensive training curriculum, plus technology-specific training and mentoring to help build upon you technical skills. You will also help guide junior members of the team, help with project proposals, client care, building relationships with peers and identifying new business opportunities. Finally as a Senior IT Consultant you will contribute to the Practice Area development and help to build the BCG brand as a key member of the case team.What You'll BringAt least 3 years of experience in IT Strategy and consulting, professional software development or IT project management¬∑ Prior IT consulting experience preferable¬∑ A strategic thinker, entrepreneurial, able to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment¬∑ Outstanding analytical and conceptual skills, strong customer focus and mental agility with a results orientation¬∑ Experience in legacy environments and modern approaches to technology¬∑ Track record of Agile consulting and advisory with experience in Digital and Agile transformations at scale¬∑ Experience in IT organization and process development¬∑ Experience in the organization of workshops at peer level and facilitating in client meetings¬∑ Strong business acumen; can frame complex problems in appropriate business contexts¬∑ A University degree with above average academic performance in a STEM related field or business management¬∑ Fluent in English and FrenchBoston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.BCG is an E - Verify Employer.Click herefor more information on E-Verify.

job_title: Trade Marketing, Digital and Operations Manager NWA
description: About the jobGalderma is the emerging pure-play dermatology category leader, present in approximately 90 countries. We deliver an innovative, science-based portfolio of premium flagship brands and services that span the full spectrum of the fast-growing dermatology market through Injectable Aesthetics, Dermatological Skincare and Therapeutic Dermatology. Since our foundation in 1981, we have dedicated our focus and passion to the human body's largest organ - the skin - meeting individual consumer and patient needs with superior outcomes in partnership with healthcare professionals. Because we understand that the skin, we are in shapes our lives, we are advancing dermatology for every skin story.We look for people who focus on getting results, embrace learning and bring a positive energy. They must combine initiative with a sense of teamwork and collaboration. Above all, they must be passionate about doing something meaningful for consumers, patients, and the healthcare professionals we serve every day. We aim to empower each employee and promote their personal growth while ensuring business needs are met now and into the future. Across our company, we embrace diversity and respect the dignity, privacy, and personal rights of every employee.At Galderma, we actively give our teams reasons to believe in our bold ambition to become the leading dermatology company in the world. With us, you have the ultimate opportunity to gain new and challenging work experiences and create an unparalleled, direct impact.Trade Marketing, Digital and Operations Manager NWAMorocco,CasablancaJob DescriptionResponsible for developing and executing marketing strategies that drive product demand at the retail level. This role involves collaborating with sales teams, retailers, and distributors to enhance product visibility and maximize sales. The role will optimize channel partnerships with a focus on customer channels such as pharmacies, ensuring seamless implementation of agreed point-of-sale (POS) activities in alignment with Galderma Global guidelines. This role involves overseeing various digital marketing channels, analyzing performance metrics, and ensuring the alignment of digital initiatives with business objectives of the Cluster in alignment with Galderma Global to enhance overall customer experience.Duties & ResponsibilitiesManage Channel Partnerships:Develop collaborative strategies with partners to effectively promote products and services to customers. Monitor localization of this strategy by distributor to main channels: pharmacies, etc.Ensure Implementation of POS Activities:Oversee the execution of agreed point-of-sale (POS) activities according to Galderma Global guidelines, ensuring consistency and alignment with brand standards.Monitor POS initiatives to track effectiveness and adjustments in collaboration with Galderma distributors as necessary to optimize results.Work closely with Galderma Global and Region e-commerce and digital teams to integrate channel partnership strategies with e-retailers or other POS.Coordinate efforts with Cluster Team to ensure synergy and alignment of objectives across the organization.Organize Trade Promotional Activities:Create, adapt and implement comprehensive trade marketing strategies that align with the company's overall marketing goals.Design and execute promotional campaigns, including in-store displays, product sampling, and point-of-sale materials to drive product visibility.Conduct market research to identify trends, customer preferences, and competitive activities to inform trade marketing decisions.Work closely with sales distributor teams to develop tailored strategies for specific retailers and channels.Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of trade marketing initiatives, using metrics to assess performance and make data-driven adjustments.Tracking of Promotional Spend vs allocated budgetsDigital Marketing Strategy:Create and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies, including SEO, SEM, email marketing, social media, and content marketing.Plan, launch, and manage digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms to drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversions.Monitor and analyze the performance of
